CommentBody:
Might be worth checking this permission:
- Granted the "Network access: Restrict clients allowed to make remote calls to SAM" Local Policies > Security Options privilege

If it's an admin share, it'll need to be a local admin on the fs as well

We performed further investigation of the issue by replicating this issue in our labs. We have created a discussion without the development team and will provide an update. I will continue to keep this ticket open until an update has been provided.

https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:bfc03607c1094e528b56f819d6ec30cf@thread.tacv2/1719265037979?tenantId=097499ff-179d-4959-ab02-86d364125bfc&groupId=72f83b71-3180-482b-b588-9595342c5a50&parentMessageId=1719265037979&teamName=SWAT%20Teams%3A%20Product%20Discussions%2C%20PM%20Q%26A%2C%20Feedback&channelName=StealthAUDIT%20DAG&createdTime=1719265037979
We resolved the issue by changing group membership permissions to Access Control Assistance Operators to reflect the updated LPA recommendations for WinServer 2022 and later.
